column1: It is noteworthy that, Justice Salam in Stephan Gunaratne v. Thushara Indika Sampath (supra)
also referred to a similar purpose of the Act No. 54 of 2006,
“Appreciably, Section 5A of Act No 54 of 2006 quite specifically states that all relevant
written laws applicable to an appeal, in the Court of Appeal, are applicable to the High
Court as well. This undoubtedly demonstrates beyond any iota of doubt that the scheme
provided by Act No 54 of 2006 to facilitate an appeal being heard by the Provincial High
Court is nothing but a clear transfer of jurisdiction and in effect could be said that as far
as appeals are concerned both the High Court and the Court of Appeal rank equally and
are placed on par with each other.”
